CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
May 2020 – present ABB  
Position:  Head of Government Relations and Public Affairs for the European Union  
• Built ABB’s EU representation office from the ground up fol lowing the 2020 corporate 
restructuring.  
• Defining the public affairs strategy and budget for Europe (and KPIs) in line with relevant 
business objectives.  
• Leading on the adaptation of ABB’s group narrative and strategic priorities for EU audiences in 
Brussels and key capitals e.g. on green electrification, hydrogen, AI, energy efficiency, 
sustainable mobility and industrial decarbonisation.  
• Positioning ABB as a thought leader & trusted advisor in EU policy circles by providing timely 
and relevant input  to decisionmakers and shaping the discussion amongst policy ‘influencers’ 
(NGOs, think tanks, academia).  
 • Securing timely and relevant EU insights and intelligence to ABB’s senior leaders across 
businesses and support functions to support their strategic  decision making (e.g. on 
political/regulatory risk and EU sanctions).  
• Facilitating interaction between ABB business leaders and EU and member States’ decision 
makers.  
• Supporting business executives, including the CEO, in high -level organisations such as the 
European Roundtable of Industry (ERT), the European Clean Hydrogen Alliance (ECH2A) and 
the “CEO Alliance for Europe’s Recovery, Reform and Resilience” (chair of the policy task 
force).  
• Representing ABB in industry associations (Orgalim, European Clean Hydrogen Alliance, Wind 
Europe, ChargeUp Europe, CEMEP, T&D Europe).  
• Chair of the Sustainable Transport Task Force at Orgalim – Europe’s Technology Industry 
Association  
 
Sept 2013 – April 2020 ENI 
 
June 2015 – April 2020  
Position: EU Government Affairs Manager – Climate,  Energy, Policy and Sustainable Finance 
Lead  
• Deputy Head of the Brussels Office, responsible for a team of 3 addressing climate (Carbon 
pricing, COP negotiations, Sustainable Finance) and energy policies (natural gas, hydrogen and 
renewable energy).  
• Developed Eni’s EU climate and energy policy strategy, defining positions and messages in 
close coordination with relevant b usiness functions and with the sustainability department.  
• Successfully managed the “Make Power Clean” campaign, which involved 17 major 
stakeholders for the phase -out of public financial support to coal power plants 
(www.makepowerclean.eu). The campaign outperformed its original goals, in time and under 
budget through efficient stakeholder coordination and a successful outreach strategy across 
Europe.  
• Represented Eni in multiple international trade associations. EU Sherpa for the CEO in the 
European Rou ndtable of Industrialists (ERT).  
 
Sept 2013 – June 2015  
Position:  European  Government Affai rs Advisor

a thought leader in Brussels beyond the energy sector (e.g. digitalisation, transport, 
development policy and geopolitics).  
• Provided timely analysis and reporting on EU political/policy trends relev ant to Eni’s business.  
• Drafted briefings, speeches, and op -eds for Eni’s senior executives.
